alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 5:13PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Johnson County through 545 PM MDT... At 512 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort Phil Kearny Historical Site, or 16 miles northwest of Buffalo, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail and brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Johnson County. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 42 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Riverton.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County
